column5: I am curious to know if anyone uses these and do they actually work and not leak?  http://www.berkley-fishing.com/products/tools-equipment/classics/bait-management-center-6-container  Thanks
I used it all last year. Like it, didn't leak. I would have like to have less small containers and more larger ones, but that's me.
I wish they'd just sell the stuff in non leaking containers.  I transfer all my Gulp to a suitable sized rubbermaid container with a screw on lid. They come in all sizes and they're cheap.
I put teflon tape on all my jars this season.  So far so good.

You should be able to pickup the plastic "pee sample containers" with the yellow lid at a craft shop etc. Tight seal and inexpensive to buy. I used them for Jensen eggs as well as their container tends to leak.
I use the same containers Solo mentioned, much cheaper, durable and never leaks.
I've been using the Plano liquid bait locker and have been quite please with it.

To be honest, one word to say "LEAK" no matter what container(I have the container from Berkly but still leak" you use. I give up to use the juicy one but I am still one of Berkley loyal customer but I switch back to the dry lure.
Picked up the Gulp management system last year...it leaks!...but still alot better then the original containers.

I like this thing; used it over a year and still no leaks. It has a double seal and you have to press very hard to close it. If you don't and only get to the first seal, it will leak a little bit. Best of all the shape conforms to my tackle bags/totes. No more messing with bottles and jars.

I have never had a gulp container leak once out of 6-8 I have bought I always leave the foam seal on it that is glued to the container only open it half way and it won't leak. I have given up on the tubs the packages are way softer and it seems to me that there's A LOT of old tubs kicking around with hard unuseable baits in them it's a bit pricey to buy the bags but I like the feel of the baits better. I also only use the 3-4" minnows for drop shotting .

Never used it. Why bother, when there are cheaper methods that can resolve this?  When I but the smaller containers (2" Minnow) from Gulp!Alive, I just go visit my local Walk-In Clinic and take a few piss sample jars!  Hahaha... Not filled of course!
I use lidlock from Canadian Tire and they are like 4 bucks. Not paying 20 bucks for Berkleys. THese work perfectly.
